page.title: 15Crowhill Pumping Station
page.content: Crowhill Pumping Station was built round about 1960 for the ESSO Refinery and has{three large pumps}with a power {of 375 h.p.each. Since Esso has left Pembrokeshire the pumping station is not in constant use but is the back up for Canaston:_ if anything goes wrong at Canaston, water can be pumped directly from the Cleddau River. Sometime ago, holes were bored in the bed of the river to improve the water. There is a well near the pumping station. They have no polluton monitor there, as they have at Canaston. {** The Depot At Withybush ** { }It is a large new building where about 120 people work for The Welsh Water Authority, which is responsible now for sewage and rivers as well as water supply to homes.
